availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Matthew R. Waller (Union County, Kentucky, merchant)

body.p: Morganfield, Union County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Martha C. Parker Waller in Union County on November 23, 1858. Father of George Waller. Merchant in Union County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union, Morganfield, p. 531.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Union, Morganfield, p. 416B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, Morganfield Precinct, p. 350B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Union County Marriages, Film #000562203, p. 467 of 517 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "Matthew R. Waller (1833-1908)," Memorial #103749915, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/103749915 (accessed January 24, 2020).
